summary: There is a vast, aging Coast Guard infrastructure along the shore that includes piers, docks, and other facilities. The Coast Guard estimated that its backlog of construction and improvement projects would take $1.7 billion and 395 years to address. That doesn't include the Coast Guard's maintenance backlog, which would bring the total cost to at least $2.6 billion. While the Coast Guard has a culture...
title: Coast Guard Shore Infrastructure: Applying Leading Practices Could Help Better Manage Project Backlogs of at Least $2.6 Billion
